author: Adil M. Bagirov and John Yearwood
title: A new nonsmooth optimization algorithm for clustering
venue: Centre for Informatics and Applied Optimization, School of Information Technology and Mathematical Sciences, University of Ballarat
window: some databases with known classes. We used the diabetes, liver disorder, heart disease, breast cancer, vehicles, synthetic, pen-based recognition of handwritten digits (PBRHD) and image segmentation data sets in numerical experiments. Descriptions of these data sets can be found in [24]. First, we normalized all features. This was done by a nonsingular matrix so that mean values of all features were 1.
